member.name: WS_ISSUED_TOKEN_MESSAGE_SECURITY_BINDING_CONSTRAINT
member.summary: A security binding constraint that can be used to extract information about how to obtain an issued token from an issuing party.

summary.para: The base binding constraint that this binding constraint derives from.
There are currently no binding-specific properties defined for this binding constraint.

member.name: WS_ISSUED_TOKEN_MESSAGE_SECURITY_BINDING_CONSTRAINT.bindingUsage
member.summary: This specifies how the issued token should be attached to a message.

member.name: WS_ISSUED_TOKEN_MESSAGE_SECURITY_BINDING_CONSTRAINT.claimConstraints
member.summary: This field contains a list of claim types that are allowed in the policy. Each claim type is a URI which identifies the type of claim.

summary.para: The number of elements in the claimConstraints array.
If this value is 0, then the claimConstraints array may beNULL, and any claims are allowed to appear in the policy.
A set of property constraints relating to how to request a security token.
The number of elements in the requestSecurityTokenPropertyConstraints array.
If the array has zero elements, the requestSecurityTokenPropertyConstraints field may be NULL.

member.name: WS_ISSUED_TOKEN_MESSAGE_SECURITY_BINDING_CONSTRAINT.out
member.summary: When returns NOERROR, the entire contents of this structure will be filled out.
